intro: Pleurothallis millipeda, commonly known as the thousand-legs orchid, is a species of orchid native to the cloud forests of Central and South America. It is a small, epiphytic plant that typically grows on trees in shaded, humid environments. The plant features slender, wiry stems and produces clusters of small, pale green to white flowers. Its leaves are narrow and often clustered at the base, contributing to its compact appearance. Pleurothallis millipeda is valued for its unique morphology and is often cultivated by orchid enthusiasts.
